1:
Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
\q
2:
If anyone tries to speak with you, will you be impatient?
\q But who can stop himself from speaking?
\q
3:
See, you have instructed many;
\q you have strengthened weak hands.
6:
Is not your fear your confidence,
\q and the integrity of your ways your hope?
7:
Think about this, please: who has ever perished when innocent?
\q Or when were the upright people ever cut off?
\q
8:
According to what I have seen, those who plow iniquity
\q and sow trouble reap it.
\q
9:
By the breath of God they perish;
\q by the blast of his anger they are consumed.
10:
The roaring of the lion, the voice of the fierce lion,
\q the teeth of the young lionsâ€”they are broken.
\q
11:
The old lion perishes for lack of victims;
\q the cubs of the lioness are scattered everywhere.
12:
Now a certain matter was secretly brought to me,
\q and my ear received a whisper about it.
\q
13:
Then came thoughts from visions in the night,
\q when deep sleep falls on people.
14:
It was at night when fear and trembling came upon me,
\q and all my bones shook.
\q
15:
Then a spirit passed before my face,
\q and the hair of my flesh stood up.
16:
The spirit stood still, but I could not discern its appearance.
\q A form was before my eyes;
\q there was silence, and I heard a voice that said,
\q
17:
"Can a mortal man be more righteous than God?
\q Can a man be more pure than his Maker?
19:
how much more is this true of those who live in houses of clay,
\q whose foundation is in the dust,
\q who are crushed sooner than a moth?
21:
Are not their tent cords plucked up among them?
\q They die; they die without wisdom.
